column4: hi, installed apache2 and configured it for https access - unable to access http on port 80 now. Any ideas?
How did you configure it? You've got separate virtual hosts, yeah?
yeh, sepearte vhosts - also have ports 80 and 443 listed in ports.conf!
What happens with you try to access it on 80?
bad request error - hint use https
I'd need to see your conf
You've reloaded the config, right?
reloaded server after each change, whats the url for pastebin?
posted config files here http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/50365/ - thanks.
I can't check because of my little X problem, but I think you need to qualify each virtual host entry with a port.
i'll try and let you know result..
no joy adding Listen to vhosts - also get error when specifically set port in url...
still no joy - the server is always listening on port 443 regardless, despite having port 80 and 443 listed in ports.conf. Will keep plugging away.
If I get my problem fixed I'll start up my VM and check those settings.
cheers - its appreciated.
You still there?
hi - still here
You need NameVirtualHost *:80 and NameVirtualHost *:443
both for each vhost?
No no. Put both NameVirtualHost entries at the top.
ah - ok. will try now...
But then you must have <VirtualHost *:##> entries for each (80 and 443)
And make sure there's no SSL stuff in the :80 virtual host.
